bibRefCitation.refString: Qin, Y. Y., Liu, X. W. & Li, K. (2017) Review of the genus Microtachycines Gorochov with two new species (Orthoptera, Rhaphidophoridae, Aemodogryllinae) from China. Zootaxa, 4126 (6), 596 - 600. https: // doi. org / 10.11646 / zootaxa. 4216.6.6

subSubSection.paragraph:
Microtachycines elongatus : Qin, Liu & Li, 2017
, Zootaxa, 4216 (6): 597.

Microtachycines fallax : Qin, Liu & Li, 2017
, Zootaxa, 4216(6): 600. ( synonym )

Type specimen:
male; type locality: Qingliangfeng , Lin’an , Zhejiang ; location of type specimen: Shanghai Entomological Museum , Chinese Academy of Science ( SEM , CAS )
.
Coloration. Whole body dark brown with conspicuous stripes. Frons with 4 longitudinal stripes (under antenna and eyes possess 1 pair separately) ( Fig. 1 ). Legs with black annular stripes.
Measurements (in mm). Body ♂ ♀ 10.0–18.0; pronotum ♂ ♀ 6.5–7.5; fore femur ♂ ♀ 9.0–12.5; hind femur ♂ ♀ 17.5–25.5; hind tibiae ♂ ♀ 19.5–26.5; ovipositor ♀ 8.0–12.5.

Distribution. China ( Zhejiang , Hubei , Jiangxi , Fujian ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–8.
Microtachycines elongatus Qin, Liu & Li, 2017
. 1. Head, frontal view; 2. Fastigium of vertex, dorsal view; 3. Spine in internal genicular lobe of fore femur, ventral view; 4. Abdominal apex of male, dorsal view; 5. Hind tibiae, lateral view; 6. Ovipositor of female, lateral view; 7. Male genitalia, dorsal view; 8. Subgenital plate of female, ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Discussion. When this species was reported, its type locality was given as Qingliangfeng of Zhejiang and the specimens were adults.
Microtachycines fallax
Qin et al. , 2017
was also reported at the same time, its type locality, Jiugongshan and Wujiashan, Hubei , but the specimens were nymphs. More specimens have been collected from above two type localities recent years, diagnostic characters i.e. male genitalia and female subgenital plate of adult individuals from Jiugongshan of Hubei are same with
Microtachycines elongatus
Qin et al. , 2017
, other descriptions are almost identical.Another important point deserves to be mentioned is that characters of nymph individuals from Qingliangfeng of Zhejiang ( Fig. 7c, 7d ) is same as
M. fallax
from Wujiashan of Hubei ( Figs. 7a, 7b ) when reported. In conclusion, we consider that
M. fallax
can be considered as a synonym of
M. elongatus
. Up to now, species
Microtachycines elongatus Qin, Liu & Li, 2017
possesses an extensive distribution, including Zhejiang (Qingliangfeng, Tianmushan, Gutianshan), Hubei (Jiugongshan, Wujiashan), Fujian (Wuyishan), Jiangxi (Sanqingshan).
